intro: Carduncellus araneosus var. macrocephalus, commonly known as the giant spiny spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its large, spiny, and lobed leaves, which are typically green with a waxy coating. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. This species is known for its toxic sap, which can cause skin irritation and is a defense mechanism against herbivores.
